meanings.definition: Of or relating to Orpheus or his poetry.
meanings.sent1: The orphical music filled the room with a sense of magic.
meanings.sent2: Her voice had an orphical quality that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The orphical melody seemed to make the flowers dance in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The orphical words of the poet painted a vivid picture in the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The orphical nature of the song transported the listeners to a dreamlike state.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of Orpheus or his poetry.
meanings.sent1: The painting had an orphical touch, reminiscent of ancient tales.
meanings.sent2: His storytelling had an orphical charm that drew people in.
meanings.sent3: The orphical decorations in the room added a touch of mystery to the party.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed around her like an orphical river of fabric.
meanings.sent5: The orphical aura of the forest at night was both enchanting and eerie.
